body.p:
To the Honbl. B. Magoffin
Governor of Comwlth Ky.

The undersigned your petitioners would respectfully state that at the special term of the Carroll Circuit Court held in Nov 1860 John King was fined Twenty dollars for gaming on premises -- Your petitioners further state that the game was a trifling stake, amusement being the object King is not a gambler, seldom plays cards he is a poor man, unable to work, and has a family -- We therefore pray your excellency to remit said fine

John King
W M Fisher
W. L. Ringo
W Murphey
Allen Wright
J W Spencer
Owen Driskill
William W Webb
P. U. Major C: Atty

Carroll
Cir. Ct.
Respite 12 mos
B. M
$20 } Gaming
John King
Issd Jany 24 1861
